references.paper_title: Revisiting neural scaling laws in language and vision
references.reason: This paper provides context on the scaling laws of neural networks, which are crucial to understanding the challenges addressed by the proposed PETRA method for efficient parallel training.

references.paper_title: The reversible residual network: Backpropagation without storing activations
references.reason: This paper introduces the concept of reversible architectures, forming the foundation for the parallel training technique in PETRA, significantly reducing memory overhead.
This paper introduces the concept of invertible neural networks which are further improved by the PETRA method.

references.paper_title: Imagenet: A large-scale hierarchical image database
references.reason: This paper introduces the ImageNet dataset, which is used as a benchmark for evaluating the performance of the PETRA method in image classification tasks.

references.paper_title: Learning multiple layers of features from tiny images
references.reason: This paper introduces the CIFAR dataset, used for evaluating the performance of the PETRA method in image classification tasks, alongside ImageNet.
